snippet: Only a few historical markers and dim memories remain of a railroad built by a Chinese man who made his fortune in the United States.
abstract: Jiangmen Journal; Beijie train station in Jiangmen, China, is the most prominent survivor of the Xinning Railway, ambitious attempt by 20th-century Chinese businessman Chen Yixi to help modernize his home county; project was a precursor of today's high-speed rails, but it was a private one and China's first, built solely through the efforts of one man clinging to a vision of strengthening China.

byline.contributor: Alan Chin contributed reporting from Taishan City. Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Only a few historical markers and dim memories remain of a railroad built by a Chinese man who made his fortune in the United States.

headline.main: A Long Goodbye for a Lost Railroad
headline.print_headline: A Long Goodbye for a Lost Railroad
